sen.j: 菅南涯（かん なんがい、生卒年不詳）は、江戸時代中期の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Nangai KAN (dates of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the middle of the Edo period.
Nangai KAN (dates of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the middle of the Edo period.
Nangai KAN (dates of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the middle of the Edo period.
The Shimizu family.
The Shimizu family.
The Shimizu family.

sen.j: 本姓が菅原氏であったので中国風に修して菅とした。
sen.e: His main name was Sugawara, and so he changed it to Chinese style and made it to Kan.
His main name was Sugawara, and so he changed it to Chinese style and made it to Kan.
His main name was Sugawara, and so he changed it to Chinese style and made it to Kan.

sen.j: 名は周監、字を子文、南涯は号 (称号)である。
sen.e: His name was 周監, azana (adult male's nickname) was 子文, and Nangai was his second name or alias.
His name was 周監, azana (adult male's nickname) was 子文, and Nangai was his second name or alias.

His common name was Katsuemon SHIMIZU.
His common name was Katsuemon SHIMIZU.

He was from Kyoto Prefecture.
He was from Kyoto Prefecture.
He was from Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 高芙蓉に就いて篆刻を学ぶ。
sen.e: He learned tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Fuyo KO.
He learned tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Fuyo KO.
He learned tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Fuyo KO.

sen.j: 源惟良が編集した『芙蓉山房私印譜』にその刻した印が掲載される。
sen.e: "Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu," which was compiled by Iryo GEN, contains the seal he engraved.
"Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu," which was compiled by Iryo GEN, contains the seal he engraved.
"Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu," which was compiled by Iryo GEN, contains the seal he engraved.

sen.j: 自らの印譜に『南涯印譜』2巻がある。
sen.e: His own Inpu include two volumes of "Nangai Inpu."
His own Inpu (compilation of seal marks) include two volumes of "Nangai Inpu."
